verses.verse: Then Jehovah<WH3068> answered<WH6030> Job<WH347> out of the whirlwind<WH5591>, and said<WH6030>,
Who is this that darkeneth<WH2821> counsel<WH6098> By words<WH4405> without knowledge<WH1847>?
Gird up<WH247> now thy loins<WH2504> like a man<WH1397>; For I will demand of thee<WH7592>, and declare thou unto me.
Where <WH375> wast thou when I laid the foundations<WH3245> of the earth<WH776>? Declare<WH5046>, if thou hast<WH3045> understanding<WH998>.
Who determined<WH7760> the measures<WH4461> thereof<WH3045>, if thou knowest? Or who stretched<WH5186> the line upon it<WH6957>?
Whereupon were the foundations<WH134> thereof fastened<WH2883>? Or who laid<WH3384> the corner<WH6438> - stone thereof<WH68>,
When the morning<WH1242> stars<WH3556> sang<WH7442> together<WH3162>, And all the sons<WH1121> of God<WH430> shouted for joy<WH7321>?
Or who shut up<WH5526> the sea<WH3220> with doors<WH1817>, When it brake forth<WH1518>, as if it had issued out<WH3318> of the womb<WH7358>;
When I made<WH7760> clouds<WH6051> the garment<WH3830> thereof<WH6205>, And thick darkness a swaddling-band<WH2854> for it,
And marked<WH7665> out for it my bound<WH2706>, And set<WH7760> bars<WH1280> and doors<WH1817>,
And said<WH559>, Hitherto<WH5704> shalt thou come<WH935>, but no further<WH3254>; And here shall thy proud<WH1347> waves<WH1530> be stayed<WH7896>?
Hast thou commanded<WH6680> the morning<WH1242> since thy days<WH3117> began<WH7837>, And caused the dayspring to know<WH3045> its place<WH4725>;
That it might take hold<WH270> of the ends<WH3671> of the earth<WH776>, And the wicked<WH7563> be shaken out of it<WH5287>?
It is changed<WH2015> as clay<WH2563> under the seal<WH2368>; And all things stand<WH3320> forth as a garment<WH3830>:
And from the wicked<WH7563> their light<WH216> is withholden<WH4513>, And the high<WH7311> arm<WH2220> is broken<WH7665>.
Hast thou entered<WH935> into the springs<WH5033> of the sea<WH3220>? Or hast thou walked<WH1980> in the recesses<WH2714> of the deep<WH8415>?
Have the gates<WH8179> of death<WH4194> been revealed<WH1540> unto thee<WH7200>? Or hast thou seen the gates<WH8179> of the shadow of death<WH6757>?
Hast thou comprehended<WH995> the earth<WH776> in its breadth<WH7338>? Declare<WH5046>, if thou knowest it all<WH3045>.
Where is the way<WH1870> to the dwelling<WH7931> of light<WH216>? And as for darkness<WH2822>, where is the place thereof<WH4725>,
That thou shouldest take<WH3947> it to the bound<WH1366> thereof<WH995>, And that thou shouldest discern the paths<WH5410> to the house thereof<WH1004>?
Doubtless <WH3045>, thou knowest, for thou wast then born<WH3205>, And the number<WH4557> of thy days<WH3117> is great<WH7227>!
Hast thou entered<WH935> the treasuries<WH214> of the snow<WH7950>, Or hast thou seen<WH7200> the treasures<WH214> of the hail<WH1259>,
Which I have reserved<WH2820> against the time<WH6256> of trouble<WH6862>, Against the day<WH3117> of battle<WH7128> and war<WH4421>?
By what<WH335> way<WH1870> is the light<WH216> parted<WH2505>, Or the east wind<WH6921> scattered<WH6327> upon the earth<WH776>?
Who hath cleft<WH6385> a channel<WH8585> for the waterflood<WH7858>, Or the way<WH1870> for the lightning<WH2385> of the thunder<WH6963>;
To cause it to rain<WH4305> on a land<WH776> where no man<WH376> is<WH4057>; On the wilderness, wherein there is no man<WH120>;
To satisfy<WH7646> the waste<WH4875> and desolate<WH7722> ground<WH4161>, And to cause the tender grass<WH1877> to spring forth<WH6779>?
Hath <WH3426> the rain<WH4306> a father<WH1>? Or who hath begotten<WH3205> the drops<WH96> of dew<WH2919>?
Out of whose womb<WH990> came<WH3318> the ice<WH7140>? And the hoary frost<WH3713> of heaven<WH8064>, who hath gendered it<WH3205>?
The waters<WH4325> hide<WH2244> themselves and become like stone<WH68>, And the face<WH6440> of the deep<WH8415> is frozen<WH3920>.
Canst thou bind<WH7194> the cluster<WH4575> of the Pleiades<WH3598>, Or loose<WH6605> the bands<WH4189> of Orion<WH3685>?
Canst thou lead forth<WH3318> the Mazzaroth<WH4216> in their season<WH6256>? Or canst thou guide<WH5148> the Bear<WH5906> with her train<WH1121>?
Knowest <WH3045> thou the ordinances<WH2708> of the heavens<WH8064>? Canst thou establish<WH7760> the dominion<WH4896> thereof in the earth<WH776>?
Canst thou lift up<WH7311> thy voice<WH6963> to the clouds<WH5645>, That abundance<WH8229> of waters<WH4325> may cover thee<WH3680>?
Canst thou send<WH7971> forth lightnings<WH1300>, that they may go<WH3212>, And say unto thee<WH559>, Here we are?
Who hath put<WH7896> wisdom<WH2451> in the inward parts<WH2910>? Or who hath given<WH5414> understanding<WH998> to the mind<WH7907>?
Who can number<WH5608> the clouds<WH7834> by wisdom<WH2451>? Or who can pour<WH7901> out the bottles<WH5035> of heaven<WH8064>,
When the dust<WH6083> runneth<WH3332> into a mass<WH4165>, And the clods<WH7263> cleave fast together<WH1692>?
Canst thou hunt<WH6679> the prey<WH2964> for the lioness<WH3833>, Or satisfy<WH4390> the appetite<WH2416> of the young lions<WH3715>,
When they couch<WH7817> in their dens<WH4585>, And abide<WH3427> in the covert<WH5521> to<WH3926> lie in wait<WH695>?
Who provideth<WH3559> for the raven<WH6158> his prey<WH6718>, When his young ones<WH3206> cry<WH7768> unto God<WH410>, And wander<WH8582> for lack<WH1097> of food<WH400>?
